metadata.title: Polish Settings Card Action Button Layout for Profile Hours and Preferences
metadata.prd_reference: Settings dashboard UX polish and high-legibility, fast-action interaction design

context.background: User reports `/settings` action buttons (Edit Profile, Edit Hours, Edit Preferences) look cramped/ugly because they wrap and appear constrained to narrow widths.

design_constraints.constraint: Keep button labels readable (avoid awkward 2-line wrapping).
Use responsive layout that looks intentional on mobile and desktop.
Preserve existing actions and card content semantics.

instruction.step: Refactor the card header layouts so action buttons have adequate width and do not wrap awkwardly.
Prefer responsive header/action stacks on small screens and aligned right actions on larger screens.
Use Chrome DevTools MCP to verify `/settings` desktop and mobile layouts, interactions, and console cleanliness.

validation_checklist.check: Edit Profile, Edit Hours, and Edit Preferences buttons render cleanly without cramped two-line labels.
Desktop and mobile layouts remain visually balanced.
Typecheck passes and MCP verification is recorded.

acceptance_criteria.criterion: Settings card header action buttons are readable and visually aligned on small and large screens.
Task XML is updated with evidence and renamed `DONE_` on completion.

output_spec.commit_message: refactor(healio-settings): polish card action button layouts

evidence.item: Record changed components, typecheck result, MCP desktop/mobile verification, and commit refs.

execution_tracking.completion_signal: Task is done only when state=DONE, is_done=true, completed_at is filled, verification_status=PASSED, and evidence is recorded.

references.verification_tool: Chrome DevTools MCP (required for frontend task verification)
